intro: Actinocephalus macrocephalus, commonly known as the large-headed actinocephalus, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its unique, star-shaped flowers and thick, cylindrical stems make it a visually striking addition to rock gardens and arid landscapes. Actinocephalus macrocephalus is well adapted to dry conditions, storing water in its leaves and being drought-tolerant.
